# core.vectors.VectorExpression { #optyx.core.vectors.VectorExpression }

```python
core.vectors.VectorExpression(expressions)
```

A vector of expressions (result of vector arithmetic).

VectorExpression represents element-wise operations on vectors,
such as `x + y` or `2 * x`.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name        | Type                                                                                        | Description                                  | Default    |
|-------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------|------------|
| expressions | [Sequence](`collections.abc.Sequence`)\[[Expression](`optyx.core.expressions.Expression`)\] | List of scalar expressions, one per element. | _required_ |

## Example {.doc-section .doc-section-example}

>>> x = VectorVariable("x", 3)
>>> y = VectorVariable("y", 3)
>>> z = x + y  # VectorExpression with 3 elements
>>> z[0].evaluate({"x[0]": 1, "y[0]": 2})
3.0

## Methods

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| [dot](#optyx.core.vectors.VectorExpression.dot) | Compute dot product with another vector. |
| [eq](#optyx.core.vectors.VectorExpression.eq) | Element-wise == constraint. |
| [evaluate](#optyx.core.vectors.VectorExpression.evaluate) | Evaluate all expressions and return as list. |
| [get_variables](#optyx.core.vectors.VectorExpression.get_variables) | Return all variables these expressions depend on. |

### dot { #optyx.core.vectors.VectorExpression.dot }

```python
core.vectors.VectorExpression.dot(other)
```

Compute dot product with another vector.

#### Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name   | Type                                                                                                               | Description                         | Default    |
|--------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------|------------|
| other  | [VectorExpression](`optyx.core.vectors.VectorExpression`) \| [VectorVariable](`optyx.core.vectors.VectorVariable`) | Vector to compute dot product with. | _required_ |

#### Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type                                          | Description                     |
|--------|-----------------------------------------------|---------------------------------|
|        | [DotProduct](`optyx.core.vectors.DotProduct`) | DotProduct expression (scalar). |

#### Example {.doc-section .doc-section-example}

>>> x = VectorVariable("x", 3)
>>> y = VectorVariable("y", 3)
>>> d = x.dot(y)
>>> d.evaluate({"x[0]": 1, "x[1]": 2, "x[2]": 3, "y[0]": 4, "y[1]": 5, "y[2]": 6})
32.0

### eq { #optyx.core.vectors.VectorExpression.eq }

```python
core.vectors.VectorExpression.eq(other)
```

Element-wise == constraint.

#### Example {.doc-section .doc-section-example}

>>> x = VectorVariable("x", 3)
>>> y = VectorVariable("y", 3)
>>> constraints = x.eq(y)  # 3 constraints: x[i] == y[i]

### evaluate { #optyx.core.vectors.VectorExpression.evaluate }

```python
core.vectors.VectorExpression.evaluate(values)
```

Evaluate all expressions and return as list.

```python
core.vectors.VectorExpression.get_variables()
```
